LGTM

I'm extremely leery of any Unbounded Source not requiring some form of checkpoint. To produce elements "exactly once", a source will almost certainly need to either:
* Resume from a point it's read in the stream, or
* Update the upstream state after elements are durably committed

Even if this is not the case, returning an empty checkpoint is of extremely low complexity, as @jbonofre suggested.

The only places we appear to return a `null` checkpoint mark within the Beam repositories are for testing sources and for `UnboundedSocketReader`, which does not have a well-defined output.
